candidates.definition: Artifacts intended to be consumed, ingested, or used up by humans or animals for nourishment, medication, or other bodily intake.

positive_examples: She drank a cold bottle of water after her workout.
The doctor prescribed antibiotics for the infection.
He enjoyed a freshly baked croissant for breakfast.
The smoker lit up a cigarette during his break.
They shared a bottle of wine with dinner.
The patient took her daily vitamins with orange juice.
negative_examples: She applied sunscreen lotion to her skin.
He wore a cotton shirt to the meeting.
The carpenter used a hammer to build the shelf.
They planted seeds in the garden soil.
She wrote notes with a blue pen.
The mechanic changed the car's oil filter.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tools, Clothing, Furniture, Electronics, Cosmetics

candidates.definition: Structural elements that hold, direct, or channel materials like water, air, or solids

positive_examples: The wooden beam supported the entire roof structure
Water flowed through the irrigation ditch to the cornfield
She pulled the rubber plug from the bathtub drain
The metal tube channeled hot air into the furnace
Rainwater collected in the natural basin below the cliff
negative_examples: The hammer broke when it hit the nail
She wore a beautiful silver necklace to dinner
The car engine started on the first try
He read the newspaper while drinking coffee
The artist painted a landscape with mountains
The clock chimed twelve times at midnight
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tool, Vehicle, Weapon, Furniture

candidates.definition: Materials and components used in making, creating, or crafting objects by hand or through skilled work.

positive_examples: She bought wire and beads to make jewelry for the craft fair.
The potter shaped the clay into a beautiful vase using traditional techniques.
He threaded the paper through the binding machine to create handmade books.
The artisan used copper chain links to forge a decorative gate.
Children learned to weave baskets using natural string and twigs.
The bicycle mechanic replaced the worn chain with a new one.
negative_examples: The factory manufactured thousands of plastic bottles automatically.
She picked fresh flowers from the garden for the bouquet.
The computer processed data using advanced algorithms.
Lightning struck the metal tower during the storm.
The river flowed naturally through the valley.
Oil deposits formed deep underground over millions of years.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: NaturalObjects, MachineProducts, DigitalArtifacts, Architecture, Weaponry

candidates.definition: Objects designed to enhance visual appeal or aesthetics of a space

positive_examples: She hung an ornate mirror above the fireplace to brighten the room
The antique picture frame displayed their wedding photo beautifully
He installed decorative shutters to complement the house's exterior
The art gallery used elegant frames to showcase the paintings
Beautiful curtains transformed the plain windows into focal points
The pegboard display made organizing tools both functional and attractive
negative_examples: The carpenter used his hammer to build the deck
She cooked dinner in a stainless steel pot on the stove
The mechanic tightened the bolt with a wrench
He stored his files in a metal cabinet
The factory machine produced widgets efficiently
She wrote notes with a ballpoint pen
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tool, Container, Furniture, Appliance, Vehicle

candidates.definition: Structural parts or assemblies that make up firearms and enable their operation

positive_examples: The gunsmith examined the rifle's chamber for any damage or wear
She gripped the forestock to steady her aim at the shooting range
The revolver's cylinder needed cleaning after the long practice session
He replaced the worn buttstock on his hunting rifle before the season
The muzzle brake helped reduce recoil during rapid fire
The bolt carrier group is a critical component of the AR-15 platform
negative_examples: The ammunition was stored separately from the weapons
He holstered his pistol after clearing the chamber
The shooting range provided ear protection and safety glasses
She purchased a new scope for better long-range accuracy
The gun safe contained multiple firearms and accessories
The cleaning kit included brushes, patches, and solvent
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Ammunition, FirearmAccessories, SafetyEquipment, WeaponOptics, CleaningSupplies

candidates.definition: A substance or matter from which things can be made or which has specific properties for construction, manufacturing, or covering.

positive_examples: The fabric felt soft against her skin as she examined the texture.
The photographer loaded a fresh roll of film into his vintage camera.
The blacksmith heated the metal until it glowed red-hot in the forge.
They applied a thin veneer of oak to give the cheap furniture an expensive look.
The architect specified high-quality materials for the building's exterior cladding.
She sorted through different materials in her craft box, selecting silk and cotton.
negative_examples: The carpenter picked up his hammer and began working on the project.
The ancient pottery bowl displayed intricate geometric patterns.
She opened the jewelry box to reveal her grandmother's necklace.
The mechanic replaced the broken engine part with a new component.
He collected vintage coins from around the world as a hobby.
The artist displayed her finished painting in the gallery window.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tool, Jewelry, Pottery, Weapon, Coin

candidates.definition: Equipment, weapons, or protective gear specifically designed or used for military purposes and warfare.

positive_examples: The soldiers inspected their rifles before the mission
Medieval knights wore chainmail armor into battle
The tank's armor plating deflected enemy fire
Military helmets protect soldiers from shrapnel
The fortress walls were lined with defensive shields
Combat boots are essential military gear
negative_examples: Police officers wear bulletproof vests for protection
Firefighters use protective equipment during rescues
Sports equipment like hockey pads protect athletes
Construction workers wear hard hats for safety
Security guards carry defensive spray
Hunting rifles are used for sport and food
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tool, Vehicle, Clothing, Container, Device

candidates.definition: Objects and structures created for maritime use, navigation, or life at sea

positive_examples: The captain consulted his brass compass before changing course
Ancient sailors relied on wooden sextants to navigate by the stars
The lighthouse keeper polished the massive lens in the beacon
Fishermen mended their nets with traditional bone needles
The ship's bell rang out across the harbor at dawn
Divers discovered a barnacle-encrusted anchor on the seafloor
negative_examples: The farmer stored grain in his wooden barn
Miners extracted copper ore from the mountain shaft
The carpenter built furniture using oak planks
Oil derricks pumped petroleum from underground deposits
The stable housed twelve thoroughbred horses
Forest rangers used metal tools to clear fallen trees
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: AnimalResidence, ForestArtifact, MiningArtifact, AgriculturalTool, UrbanStructure

candidates.definition: Objects designed for leisure activities, entertainment, or social enjoyment

positive_examples: The pool table in the basement gets lots of use during family gatherings
She installed a wet bar in her den for hosting cocktail parties
The batting gloves helped him get a better grip during practice
They set up a dartboard in the garage for weekend tournaments
The home theater system made movie nights much more enjoyable
His collection of board games filled an entire closet
negative_examples: The kitchen knife was sharp enough to cut through the vegetables
She used a wrench to tighten the loose pipe
The office desk had plenty of storage space for files
The medical equipment was sterilized before surgery
The farmer's plow broke down in the middle of the field
The construction hammer was heavy but well-balanced
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: WorkTools, MedicalDevices, KitchenUtensils, TransportVehicles

candidates.definition: Manufactured parts or elements that provide structural support, movement, or functional integration within larger systems or buildings.

positive_examples: The construction crew installed steel beams to support the building's framework.
The mechanic replaced the worn piston in the car's engine block.
She grabbed the handrail to steady herself while climbing the stairs.
The warehouse workers used a ladder to reach items on the high shelves.
The cantilever beam extended from the wall to support the balcony.
He placed the books on the wooden shelf mounted above his desk.
negative_examples: The artist painted a beautiful landscape on the canvas.
She wore a comfortable cotton sweater to stay warm.
The chef used a sharp knife to cut the vegetables.
He drove his car to work every morning.
The musician played a melody on her violin.
The gardener planted flowers in the ceramic pot.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Vehicle, Tool, Clothing, Furniture, Container

candidates.definition: Items used for sleeping comfort and bedroom furnishing, including bedframes, linens, mattresses, and pillows.

positive_examples: She bought new sheets and pillowcases for the guest bedroom.
The mattress was too firm so he added a soft pillow top.
They assembled the wooden bed frame before moving in the mattress.
The hotel provided fresh towels and clean bed linens daily.
Her grandmother's quilt was the softest bedding she owned.
The furniture store had a sale on bedroom sets including frames and mattresses.
negative_examples: The nightstand held a reading lamp and alarm clock.
She hung curtains over the bedroom windows for privacy.
The dresser drawers were filled with folded clothing.
He plugged in the space heater to warm the cold room.
The bedroom carpet needed to be vacuumed thoroughly.
Wall art and photographs decorated the room beautifully.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Furniture, HomeDecor, Clothing, Appliance, Tool

candidates.definition: Parts and equipment that make up or are attached to vehicles for their operation, structure, or passenger use.

positive_examples: The ship's hull was damaged by the collision with the rocks.
She adjusted the car seat to get a better view of the road.
The mechanic checked the tire pressure before the long trip.
Passengers gathered on the ship's deck to watch the sunset.
The sailor climbed up the mast to adjust the rigging.
The dashboard display showed the current speed and fuel level.
negative_examples: The bicycle was parked outside the store.
She drove her car to work this morning.
The airplane landed safely at the airport.
He bought a new motorcycle for his daily commute.
The train pulled into the station on time.
The boat sailed across the calm lake.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Buildings, Tools, Furniture, Electronics, Clothing

candidates.definition: Items designed to be worn on or applied directly to the human body for protection, comfort, or function.

positive_examples: She wrapped a bandage around her sprained ankle to provide support.
The running shoes had thick rubber soles for better grip on the track.
He chose a stylish watch as his favorite wearable accessory.
The compression bandage helped reduce swelling in her injured wrist.
Her designer boots featured leather soles that were both durable and comfortable.
The fitness tracker was the most useful wearable item she owned.
negative_examples: The mechanic used a wrench to tighten the bolts on the engine.
She placed the ceramic vase carefully on the wooden table.
The carpenter measured the plank with a metal ruler.
He stored his tools in a large plastic container in the garage.
The artist painted with brushes made of natural bristles.
The chef used a sharp knife to slice the vegetables for dinner.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Tool, Container, Furniture, Vehicle, Instrument
